intro: Haagea schwarzii, commonly known as the black alga, is a species of red algae belonging to the family Rhodophyceae. It is characterized by its dark purple to black coloration, which is due to the presence of phycobilins and other pigments. This marine algae is typically found in shallow coastal waters, where it attaches to rocks or other substrates. It plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various organisms. Haagea schwarzii is also used in some traditional medicinal practices due to its bioactive compounds.
